unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, FESTIVAL! Why You Should Embrace the Film Festival Scene
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, FESTIVAL! Why You Should Embrace the Film Festival Scene

unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinephiles! Ever feel like you're stuck in a rut, watching the same old stuff on Netflix? Well, it's time to break free and dive headfirst into the vibrant world of film festivals!
normalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinephiles! Ever feel like you're stuck in a rut, watching the same old stuff on Netflix? Well, it's time to break free and dive headfirst into the vibrant world of film festivals!

unnormalised: I know what you might be thinking: "Film festivals? Sounds a bit… arty." And yeah, some are. But trust me, there's a film festival out there for everyone, from the hardcore documentary fan to the person who just loves a good masala entertainer (think *Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge* levels of iconic).
normalised: I know what you might be thinking: "Film festivals? Sounds a bit… arty." And yeah, some are. But trust me, there's a film festival out there for everyone, from the hardcore documentary fan to the person who just loves a good masala entertainer (think *Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge* levels of iconic).

unnormalised: Think of it as a cultural feast. You get to see films you wouldn't normally find in your local PVR. Often, they're independent gems, international award-winners, or even shorts made by budding filmmakers fresh out of institutions like FTII in Pune. These festivals are a great place to discover new talent and get ahead of the curve. Imagine being able to say, "I saw that director's debut at the Jaipur International Film Festival back in 2020!" Instant bragging rights, right?

Imagine being able to say, "I saw that director's debut at the Jaipur International Film Festival back in two thousand and twenty!" Instant bragging rights, right?

unnormalised: But it’s not just about the films. Film festivals are a hub for meeting people! Network with directors, actors, writers, and fellow film lovers. Share your opinions, debate plot twists, and maybe even find your next collaborative partner. You might even bump into your favorite Bollywood star at a Q&A session! Who knows?

unnormalised: Besides the big-name festivals, don't shy away from the smaller, regional ones. You'll discover incredible stories rooted in local cultures. Think the Pondicherry International Film Festival, or even a smaller event showcasing regional cinema in, say, Bhubaneshwar.
normalised: Besides the big-name festivals, don't shy away from the smaller, regional ones. You'll discover incredible stories rooted in local cultures. Think the Pondicherry International Film Festival, or even a smaller event showcasing regional cinema in, say, Bhubaneshwar.

unnormalised: Plus, many festivals offer workshops, masterclasses, and panel discussions. You can learn about everything from screenplay writing to cinematography. Think of it as a crash course in filmmaking, all while enjoying some great cinema. Ticket prices often start from Rs. 500, and the memories are priceless.

unnormalised: So, ditch the usual movie routine and embrace the film festival scene. You might just discover your next favorite film (or even yourself!). And hey, who knows, maybe in a few years, you'll be showcasing your own film, 50 km away from Mumbai, at a festival and inspiring others!
